org.apache.flex.compiler.clients.problems

Class ProblemQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.clients.problems.ProblemQuery

  • public class ProblemQuery
extends Object
    A ProblemQuery presents a higher-level view of a problem stream; it offers facilities to enable or disable diagnostics and presents filtered and (optionally) sorted views of the underlying problem stream.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Comparator<ICompilerProblem> compareByPositionAndPhase
      This Comparator compares problems based on three criteria: file path line number problem class - ParserProblems are "less than" semantic problems.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProblemQuery()
      Construct a ProblemQuery.
      ProblemQuery(ICompilerProblemSettings problemSettings)
      Construct a ProblemQuery with settings to control how compiler problems are reported.

      Enable or disable strict semantics mode diagnostics.
      void setShowWarnings(boolean showWarnings)
      Enable or disable semantic warnings.
      void sortProblems()
      Sort the captured collection of problems so that we can filter out semantic problems that occur on the same line as parser problems.

    • Field Detail

      • compareByPositionAndPhase

        public static final Comparator<ICompilerProblem> compareByPositionAndPhase
        This Comparator compares problems based on three criteria:
      • file path
      • line number
      • problem class - ParserProblems are "less than" semantic problems.

      Construct a ProblemQuery.

      Construct a ProblemQuery with settings to control how compiler problems are reported.
      Parameters:
      problemSettings - configuration settings to control how compiler problems are reported.

  • Method Detail

    • getProblems

      public List<ICompilerProblem> getProblems()
      Gets the list of compiler problems, with no filtering or sorting.

    • setShowStrictSemantics

      public void setShowStrictSemantics(boolean isStrict)
      Enable or disable strict semantics mode diagnostics.
      Parameters:
      isStrict - - if true, strict semantics mode diagnostics will appear in the filtered diagnostics.

    • setShowWarnings

      public void setShowWarnings(boolean showWarnings)
      Enable or disable semantic warnings.
      Parameters:
      showWarnings - - if true, semantic warnings will appear in the filtered diagnostics.

    • setShowInternalErrors

      public void setShowInternalErrors(boolean showInternalErrors)
      Enable or disable internal error display.
      Parameters:
      showInternalErrors - - if true, internal error diagnostics will appear in the filtered diagnostics.

    • setShowIrrelevantProblems

      public void setShowIrrelevantProblems(boolean showIrrelevantProblems)
      Enable or disable display of "problems" that are used for compiler internal processing but have no relevance to the user.
      Parameters:
      showIrrelevantProblems - - if true, non-user-relevant diagnostics will appear in the filtered diagnostics.

    • setShowProblemByClass

      public void setShowProblemByClass(Class<? extends ICompilerProblem> problemClass,
                         boolean enable)
      Enable or disable display of a specific problem class or superclass.
      Parameters:
      problemClass - - the problem class/superclass of interest.
      enable - - if true, instances of this problem class will appear in the filtered diagnostics.

      Add an array of compiler problems to the problems collection.

      newProblems - - the problems to add.

      Add a single problem to the problems collection.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clear the underlying collection of problems.

    • getFilteredProblems

      public Iterable<ICompilerProblem> getFilteredProblems()
      Get an iterator over the set of problems that are to be reported based on the current settings. Problem categorization is built into this filter so that problems categorized as "ignore" are filtered out.
      Returns:
      an Iterable<ICompilerProblem> over the subset of problems that are of interest to the client.

    • hasFilteredProblems

      public boolean hasFilteredProblems()
      Any problems to report after filtering?
      Returns:
      true if there are filtered problems.

    • hasFilteredProblems

      public boolean hasFilteredProblems(IProblemFilter filter)
      Do any problems match the given filter?
      Parameters:
      filter - - the problem filter of interest.

    • getProblemView

      public Iterable<ICompilerProblem> getProblemView(IProblemFilter filter)
      Get a filtered view of the underlying problems.
      Parameters:
      filter - - the filter to apply.
      Returns:
      an Iterable that supplies a filtered iterator of the problems.

    • getInternalErrors

      public Iterable<ICompilerProblem> getInternalErrors()
      Get an iterator over all internal errors.

    • sortProblems

      public void sortProblems()
      Sort the captured collection of problems so that we can filter out semantic problems that occur on the same line as parser problems.

    • getErrorsAndWarnings

      public void getErrorsAndWarnings(Collection<ICompilerProblem> errors,
                        Collection<ICompilerProblem> warnings)
      Categorize the compiler problems into two bins, errors and warning.
      Parameters:
      errors - the collection where the errors are added.
      warnings - the collection where the warnings are added.

    • hasErrors

      public boolean hasErrors()
      Test if any of the problems are errors. return true if any of the problems are errors, false otherwise.
